image.altText: Two men in khaki army gear smile in a selfie, with one's face blurred.

props.synopsis: Russia has "a deep-seated hatred" of foreign fighters like Oscar Jenkins, a top Ukrainian official has warned, as DFAT investigates reports Vladimir Putin's soldiers have killed the captured Australian.

title.children: Kyiv warns Russia has 'hatred' for foreign fighters like Oscar Jenkins

image.altText: An aerial view shows a fishing boat moored near rocks

props.synopsis: Officials are investigating whether organised crime is behind a wave of illegal foreign fishing boats in Australian waters, which locals say are more sophisticated than ever before.

title.children: 'Unprecedented surge' in foreign boats entering Australian waters

image.altText: A man pushing his way through rubble of a building, which left has concrete and steel rebar in a heap.

props.synopsis: Talks have been underway in Doha for hours in a bid to reach agreement on the final elements of a deal between Israel and Hamas.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire talks and hostage deal at 'sensitive stage'

image.altText: Rent sign outside apartment inspection site with people lining up

props.synopsis: New data shows rent rises may have peaked, with prices rising at almost half the rate of 2023. Sydney and Melbourne recorded the largest deceleration in price growth, and rental yields for investors in Brisbane and Adelaide dropped below Melbourne for the first time in more than 15 years.

title.children: National rent prices grow at slowest rate in four years

image.altText: Britain's Kate, the Princess of Wales.

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales, who had been receiving treatment for cancer, has confirmed she is in remission in a post on social media.

title.children: Princess Catherine announces she's 'in remission' from cancer

image.altText: Danill Medvedev Eva Lys and Tristan Boyer composite

props.synopsis: The luckiest loser wins on five-minute's notice, Daniil Medvedev is expecting a big fine for demolishing a net camera, and the debutant from LA hoping to put a smile on people's faces, here's the five quick hits from day three of the Australian Open.

title.children: Australian Open quick hits: Medvedev's mid-court madness and rowdy fans

image.altText: A building at Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks owner Sanjeev Gupta says there is still a long road ahead to profitability for the plant but its future remains uncertain and now there are calls for government intervention.

title.children: Push for government to intervene in future of Whyalla steelworks

image.altText: Bush alight with fire at night time with smoke in the air

props.synopsis: One in 10 homes across Australia will be considered uninsurable within the next decade, according to climate change risk analysis modelling.

title.children: Rate of uninsurable Australian homes increases amid natural disasters

image.altText: Flowers and a car are covered in hot pink fire retardant

props.synopsis: Houses, cars, businesses and hillsides have been blanketed with hot pink fire retardant in anticipation of the Santa Ana winds picking up.

title.children: Firefighters brace for return of 112kph winds as LA bathed in hot pink

image.altText: Two rescue workers in orange suits and helmets search rubble for survivors after an earthquake in a mountainous region.

props.synopsis: More than 120 people have been killed after a powerful earthquake struck a remote region of Tibet, but with limited media access and China's robust censorship program, it has been difficult for people to get reliable information and check on loved ones.

title.children: A baby with six fingers and a rumour-busting monk: Tibet's quake gets political

image.altText: A three storey house sits on top of someone else's yard.

props.synopsis: A McCrae resident evacuated on Tuesday after his house was impacted by a landslide has called for the issue to be fixed, as works continue to make the site safe for people to return.

title.children: Residents call for a solution after Mornington Peninsula landslide

image.altText: A large ship sails in open ocean water on a sunny day

props.synopsis: The Philippines has threatened international lawsuits against China for the action, which it says is another sign of the country's ongoing aggression in the area.

title.children: Chinese 'monster ship' in South China Sea sparks new tensions with Philippines

image.altText: Wreckage of two cars on Leach Highway.

props.synopsis: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch says police are investigating whether a fatal crash that killed four in suburban Perth on Monday was a murder-suicide.

title.children: Police probing if head-on crash that killed four was murder-suicide

image.altText: Orange flames in the sky

props.synopsis: The Russian military accused Kyiv of using US and British-supplied missiles and promised the strikes would "not go unanswered".

title.children: Russian schools, airports closed as Ukraine launches 'massive' strikes

image.altText: A train on a city railway.

props.synopsis: Sydney train commuters have been warned to expect 'significant delays' from today amid ongoing industrial action on the rail network. Here's why a pay offer from the state government will not stop workers from taking industrial action.

title.children: Why Sydney train disruptions will continue despite a new pay offer

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A person drinking water from a glass.

props.synopsis: "Forever chemicals" were recently found above levels currently considered safe in a handful of NSW drinking water sources. This is how PFAS-contaminated water is cleaned up before it reaches your kitchen tap.

title.children: When drinking water is contaminated with PFAS, how do treatment plants make it safe?

image.altText: Hundreds of motorbikes, cars and buses in a traffic jam in Vietnam

props.synopsis: Vietnam, where 11,500 people die in traffic accidents every year, has introduced severe new penalties for those who break road rules as well as bounties for those who dob them in.

title.children: Vietnam fines reckless drivers half the average annual salary

image.altText: A bald man wearing a white t-shirt speaking to reporters, with an angry expression and one finger raised in the air

props.synopsis: The house arrest was replaced with judicial control, a lighter preventative measure pending a criminal investigation.

title.children: Influencer Andrew Tate's house arrest lifted by Romanian court

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: President-elect Donald Trump engaged in an unprecedented criminal effort to overturn his 2020 election defeat, according to a report released by the Department of Justice.

title.children: Trump engaged in 'criminal effort' to overturn 2020 election, report finds

image.altText: Cartoon image of boy with serious expression reaching hand into pool of ocean water.

props.synopsis: When Alison Lester's children's classic, Magic Beach, was written 35 years ago, it mirrored the childhood beach experience for so many. Now, a new film seeks to capture the same joy, whimsy and imagination.

title.children: Magic Beach captured how it feels as a kid on holiday, now it's a film

image.altText: A road at night covered in water

props.synopsis: Best known for its scorching summer temperatures, 100 millimetres of rain has left WA's Marble Bar cut off from the outside world. Meanwhile, a major highway cut by heavy rain has reopened in the Pilbara.

title.children: Australia's 'hottest town' left underwater after flash flooding

image.altText: Kim Birrell reacting during Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Australian qualifier Kim Birrell is rolled in just over an hour following a last-minute change of opponent in German lucky loser Eva Lys.

title.children: 'It did rattle me': Birrell emotional after shock opponent change at Open

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister has dodged questions over Liberal leader Peter Dutton's commitment to force councils to hold Australia Day events on January 26 if he wins the coming federal election.

title.children: PM refuses to bite as Dutton seeks fight on Australia Day events

image.altText: Two people tussel on an airport tarmac

props.synopsis: A Perth woman has been charged after she allegedly stabbed an Australian Federal Police officer in the neck with a pen after being hauled off a flight from Sydney.

title.children: AFP officer allegedly stabbed in neck with pen after woman hauled off plane

image.altText: A group of Australian cricketers celebrate a wicket, high-fiving and embracing in front of a crowd and in sunshine

props.synopsis: Four wickets to Alana King and Ellyse Perry's 35th ODI half century have fired Australia to a 21-run victory over England in the second match of the Women's Ashes.

title.children: Australia wins second Women's Ashes ODI to take commanding series lead

image.altText: A fire truck parked on sand near water, with floatation devices seen nearby.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy dies after being pulled from the water by emergency services at a public lake in Perth's east.

title.children: 'Everyone was in tears': Rescuer describes frantic efforts to save drowned teen

image.altText: Sandy, greyish balls on the beach

props.synopsis: Nine beaches along Sydney's Northern Beaches have closed for precautionary reasons after numerous tiny balls were found washed up on the shoreline.

title.children: Nine Sydney beaches closed after discovery of marble-sized balls

image.altText: A dead whale lays in the distance on the shore of Mangalagun Crab Creek Beach.

props.synopsis: The public is warned of increased risk from sharks and crocodiles, after numerous whale carcasses are found scattered along the coast near Broome in Western Australia.

title.children: Shark and croc warning as 10 melon-headed whales wash up dead in WA

image.altText: Smoke and flames come out of the top of a grain silo

props.synopsis: Emergency services responded to multiple triple-0 calls and evacuated a nearby beach and industrial precinct, setting up an exclusion zone, to fight the flames.

title.children: Firefighters climb 60m-high staircase to extinguish burning silos

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks at a photo of a girl

props.synopsis: Finding a child and adolescent psychiatrist for Tanya Collins's daughter became so difficult, she was forced to enter the costly private health system. She fears what the loss of about 200 of the state's psychiatrists in seven days could mean.

title.children: 'Catastrophic': Two-thirds of public sector psychiatrists set to leave in days

image.altText: A number of police stand around at a river.

props.synopsis: A person who was at the popular swimming location said he saw the man calling out for help from the water before he disappeared, but he was unable to find him during an extensive search.

title.children: Emergency services search for man missing in Murray River at Mildura

image.altText: Headshot of Don Punch, wearing a blue suit jacket and orange tie, speaking outside in sunshine.

props.synopsis: WA government minister Don Punch is named in the District Court as being one of the people who, in the late 1980s, decided to return a young boy to his home where he was allegedly being sexually abused.

title.children: WA minister named as witness in lawsuit from survivor of alleged child sex abuse

image.altText: Fire burns a structure in the Pacific Palisades.

props.synopsis: The Los Angeles fires are shaping up to be one of the most expensive disasters in US history, and due to the global nature of the insurance industry, the costs may be felt in Australia.

title.children: LA fires exposed an insurance crisis and Australians may have to pay

image.altText: Wangaratta car fire CCTV

props.synopsis: Police release CCTV showing two alleged burglars setting themselves alight after pouring liquid on the ground next to a parked car.

title.children: Alleged burglars run from scene with clothes on fire, CCTV shows
